result.execSummary:
The defendant John J Liss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--pay $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge

The Court dismisses an uncharged read-in:  DA Case #15JE1649, with a date of violation of 7/2/15, charge of Disorderly Conduct

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment  per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no violent contact with Lacey Smith
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--complete a certified Batterers' Intervention programming, if recommended by Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to submit DNA sample to designee upon demand

Arresting Agency: JCSD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Case called at 8:37am [mo]
Defendant John J Liss in court with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court dismisses an uncharged read-in:  DA Case #15JE1649, with a date of violation of 7/2/15, charge of Disorderly Conduct

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no violent contact with Lacey Smith
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--complete a certified Batterers' Intervention programming, if recommended by Agent
--no acts or threats of violence
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--pay $100 Domestic Abuse surcharge
--to submit DNA sample to designee upon demand


Days credit for time already served:  1 day
recess: 8:54am
Original bond document received from JESO on 7/24/15

ADDRESS INFO for John J Liss
Current: PO Box 117, Palmyra, WI 53156 United States  (Effective: 07-23-2015)
Prior: W4890 Tri Cty Rd Apt 49, Whitewater, WI 53190

Case called at 1:30 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant John J Liss appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert for the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Dahnert informs the Court that Mr. Liss is eligible for SPD services

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; DOB & address confirmed accurate
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-Take all prescriptions as prescribed  
-No contact with Lacey Smith or WJB
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
X  EXCEPTION - The Defendant shall be allowed contact with the above individuals & may return to Whitewater address on one occasion to obtain personal belongings if it is done before 4:00 pm on Sunday, July 26th and conditioned upon supervision by a law enforcement officer.
Recess: 1:34 pm

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 9/9/15 at 8:40 am  - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 10/6/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
